intro: Moraea ciliata var. minuta, commonly known as the dwarf ciliate moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, making it a compact and ornamental species. Its flowers are often pink or purple and bloom in late summer or early autumn. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in Mediterranean climates.
